a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Children per woman that survived childhood vs. those that died in
The total height of the pink and green areas shows the average number of children born per woman. The area in pink
shows the average number of children an average woman gave birth to who died within the first five years of life.
Data source: Gapminder (2015); UN Inter-agency Group for Child Mortality Estimation (2025)
